definitions.definition: a word or phrase that is easy to remember, used for example by a political party or in advertising to attract people’s attention or to suggest an idea quickly

examples.text: The ‘freedom to learn’ has become just another one of the government's empty slogans.
The Left was still spouting old Marxist slogans.
The principle is summed up by the slogan ‘Trade, not aid’.
They fought the election on the slogan ‘The time has come’.
They protested under the slogan ‘When women stop, everything stops!’

wordOrigin: early 16th cent.: from Scottish Gaelic sluagh-ghairm, from sluagh ‘army’ + gairm ‘shout’.
